Item.label: HttpServerConnection
Item.comments: Implementation of over HTTP.

Item.label: I18NSessionContext
Item.comments: The class represents an internationalization context of a client session. Every client of any type (e.g. standard Innovator client; standalone .NET client; etc.) has an instance of the class associated with each of its sessions. The context defines what locale, time zone, etc. are used by the session; this affects what kind of data is returned from the server and how the locale sensitive data (date, float, etc.) is formatted. The class also provides methods for converting from a locale specific formats of the session to neutral formats that are used in AML for sending\receiving data to\from Innovator server. In order to correctly build or interpret an AML it's important to remember the following: Locale sensitive types ( 'date' | 'float' | 'decimal' ) must be always presented in AML in neutral format Dates must be always presented in AML in the time zone of the session

Item.label: Innovator
Item.comments: The Innovator class provides methods for connecting to Aras Innovator Server and for performing miscellaneous mostly non-Item related operations.

Item.label: IomFactory
Item.comments: Provides method to create instances.
Item.remarks: There is no public constructor defined for this class. All its public methods are static. To get a refernce to IomFactory instance in JavaScript code one may: a) use aras.IomFactoryproperty; b) access IomFactory defined on custom HTML page. For example, customer wrote a page with the following HTML code: ... <OBJECT id="IomFactory" classId="../cbin/IOM.dll#Aras.IOM.IomFactory"></OBJECT> ... Then the IomFactory may be accessed from JavaScript as ... <script> var iomFactory = document.getElementById("IomFactory").object; var connection = iomFactory.CreateHttpServerConnection("http://", "db", "userName", "password"); </script> ...

Item.label: Item
Item.comments: The class provides interface to AML structure in memory as well as means of communication with Innovator server. Depending of Item's dom internal structure, as well as its node and nodeList values the instance of this class may represents one of the following: Single Innovator Item of an arbitrary ItemType. In this case Item.node!=null, and inside of Item.dom this node can refer to any XmlNode with localName <Item>. Notice that in case of Single item the Item.node.OuterXml will look like this <Item /> or this <Item > <prop1>a</prop1> <prop2>b</prop2> </Item> A collection of Innovator Items, as in a case when more then one Innovator Business Item being returned by the Server on a single request from client. In this case Item.nodeList!=null and Item.dom.OuterXml should comply with one of two following formats: (1) AML wrapper <AML> <Item ... /> ... <Item ... /> </AML> or (2) SOAP-Result wrapper <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <Result> <Item /> ... <Item /> </Result> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> Error as in the case when a client request results in error from the Server. In this case both Item.node and Item.nodeList are set to null, while Item.dom.OuterXml complies with the folowing format: <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <SOAP-ENV:Fault> <faultcode>...</faultcode> <faultactor>...</faultactor> <detail><...></detail> </SOAP-ENV:Fault> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> Result to represent an arbitrary text wrapped by <SOAP-ENV> <Result> tags. Again, both Item.node and Item.nodeList are set to null in this case, while Item.dom.OuterXml complies with the following format: <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <Result>[text]</Result> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> Logical to represent a set of Innovator Item's property-nodes wrapped in logical statement by one of three logical tags: <or>, <and>, or <not> usually used to specify the search criteria for the action "get". Because in this case one of three logical tags is the root tag for the logical Item.node its OuterXml may look like this: <and> <prop1>a</prop1> <prop2>b</prop2> </and> Methods of the class allow: get\set\add\remove attributes and\or properties of an item or an error, i.e. modify AML in memory send requests to server (instance of the class is interpreted as an AML request; note that server response is also returned in a form of an instance of the class, i.e. response AML is encapsulated as an Item).
Item.remarks: There are two major types of methods in the class: methods that only work with item's AML in memory and methods that communicate with Innovator server, i.e. send request(s) to and get response(s) from the server. All get\set type of methods as well as isXXX(...) (e.g. isError(), isCollection(), etc.) and add\remove methods (e.g. addRelationship(...), removeProperty(...), etc.) belong to the former group. Methods like fetchXXX(...) (e.g. fetchLockStatus()), apply(...), email(...), promote(...), lock\unlockItem(...), etc. belong to the later group. In case method sends a request to the server it must be explicitly mentioned in the method comments. If instance of the class is an "error" item, it contains a single <Fault> node that is SOAP Fault element. The SOAP Fault element is used to carry error and/or status information within a SOAP message. If present, the SOAP Fault element MUST appear as a body entry and MUST NOT appear more than once within a Body element. According to SOAP 1.1 specification the Fault element itself must contain a 'faultcode' element and a 'faultstring' element, and optionally 'faultactor' and 'detail' elements. In case of multilingual property AML may contain more than one tag for the same property where each tag will have a different value of the attribute xml:lang. Multilingual property tag without xml:lang denotes the property value for the language of the session; so, if the session language is French (language code is 'fr') then the following tags are equivalent: <name>Andre</name> and <name xml:lang='fr'>Andre</name>.

Item.label: ServerConnectionBase
Item.comments: Base class for standard implementations. This class is and so cannot be instantiated.

Item.label: WinAuthHttpServerConnection
Item.comments: The class extends the HttpServerConnection class allowing to connect to Innovator server that is configured to use Windows authentication instead of Innovator's database authentication.
Item.remarks: The class is supposed to be used only when Innovator server is configured to use native Windows authentication. The class uses credentials of the user that is currently logged on the client machine. It connects to the special aspx on server (Innovator\Client\scripts\IOMLogin.aspx) that must be setup to use Windows authentication and not use anonymous access (for more info see: http://www.aras.com/university/TechNotes/ActiveDirectory%20Configuration%20Notes.pdf and "Login Hooks.doc" that is a part of the documentation for every release).

Item.label: CallAction

arguments.parameter: AML that has to be sent to the server
Output parameter: empty XmlDocument that is filled with the server response.

Item.comments: Send a request with the specified action and AML to Innovator server and write the obtained response into the outDOM.

Item.label: Login
Item.returns: "error" item if login failed; otherwise item representing logged-in user.
Item.comments: Login into Innovator server.
Item.remarks: Sends a login request to the Innovator server using properties (URL, db, user name, etc.) of the instance. It's strongly recommended to call Login() before calling any other IOM method that sends a request to the Innovator server as in case the Innovator server is configured with security settings (session timeout, etc.) an attempt to send a request to server without prior login causes an exception.

Item.label: Logout

arguments.parameter: Pass 'true' if want to unlock locked objects on logout; 'false' otherwise

Item.comments: Logout from Innovator.
Item.remarks: Note that items can be unlocked on logout if and only if the property "unlock_on_logout" of the item's corresponding ItemType is set to "1". If this property is set to "0" the parameter "unlockOnLogout" is ignored.

Item.label: Logout
Item.comments: Logout from Innovator (do not unlock locked Items).

Item.label: Compression
Item.comments: Property specifies the way of compression of AML sent through IOM.HttpServerConnection. Value from enumeration 'CompressionType' (namespace Aras.Common.Compression) can be set. Available values are: gzip data compression to the gzip format deflate data compression to the deflate format none Default value. Data sent through IOM.HttpServerConnection aren't compressed. It is highly recommended to store type of compression you are using in configuration file of your application. Example section of application configuration file: <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="CompressionType" value="gzip"/> </appSettings > </configuration> Examples of setting value of Compression property from application configuration file. ... HttpServerConnection connection = CreateHttpServerConnection("innovatorServerUrl"); connaction.Compression = GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig(); ... private CompressionType GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() { string value = ConfigurationManager.AppSettings["CompressionType"]; if (String.IsNullOrEmpty(value)) { return CompressionType.none; } else { return (CompressionType)Enum.Parse(typeof(CompressionType), value); } } ... Dim connection As HttpServerConnection = IomFactory.CreateHttpServerConnection("connectionstring") connection.Compression = GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() ... Private Function GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() As CompressionType Dim value As String = ConfigurationManager.AppSettings("CompressionType") If (String.IsNullOrEmpty(value)) Then Return CompressionType.none Else Return CType([Enum].Parse(GetType(CompressionType), value), CompressionType) End If End Function

Item.label: ReadWriteTimeout
Item.comments: Gets or sets a time-out in milliseconds when writing to or reading from a stream.
Item.exception: The value specified for a set operation is less than zero and is not equal to System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite

Item.label: Timeout
Item.comments: Gets or sets the time-out value in milliseconds for the System.Net.HttpWebRequest.GetResponse() and System.Net.HttpWebRequest.GetRequestStream() methods.
Item.exception: The value specified is less than zero and is not System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite.

Item.label: ConvertFromNeutral

arguments.parameter: Locale specific string representation of a value that has to be converted.
Type of the value; only the following types are considered to be locale specific - 'date' | 'float' | 'decimal'
The parameter is taken into consideration only if vtype='date'. In this case the parameter can have one the following values: short_datelong_dateshort_date_timelong_date_timeshort_timelong_time

Item.returns: Locale specific string representation of the svalue.
Item.comments: Converts from neutral format into the format specific for the session locale.
Item.exception: svalue does not contain a valid string representation of the type defined by the vtype

Item.label: ConvertNeutralToUtcDateTime

arguments.parameter: A string that represent a date-time in the time zone of the session in neutral format.

Item.returns: The convertation result.
Item.comments: Converts a date-time in the time zone of the session in neutral format to a string that represents the same moment of time in UTC.
Item.exception: No time zones with name=the session time zone name found
inPattern supposes time offset
neutralStr is not in neutral format
The method is running on not supported platform

Item.label: ConvertToNeutral

arguments.parameter: Locale specific string representation of a value that has to be converted.
Type of the value; only the following types are considered to be locale specific - 'date' | 'float' | 'decimal'

The parameter is taken into consideration only if vtype='date'. In this case user can specify the exact format that is used in the string representation of a date in svalue. In case vtype='date' but the parameter is not specified or passed as null or empty string then an attempt is made to parse the svalue assuming that it has a valid format for the session locale.

Item.comments: Convert svalue that is a string representation of value of type vtype into the neutral format. It is assumed that svalue has a format that is a valid format for the session locale.
Item.remarks: Note that in case vtype='date' and svalue contails time zone offset (e.g. "2008-10-22T16:20:00-0500") the svalue represents a concrete moment of time which is different from the case when svalue doesn't have an offset (e.g. "2008-10-22T16:20:00") because "no offset" value can be interpreted as different moments of time depending of the time zone in which the value is processed. If svalue doesn't have an offset it's interpreted as the date-time in the time zone of the session. If svalue has an offset (i.e. it represents a concrete moment of time) it's represented as the same moment of time in the time zone of the session. For instance, if time zone of the session is "Eastern Standard Time" and svalue is "2008-12-25T18:25:00+0100" then the methods returns "2008-12-25T12:25:00".
Item.exception: svalue does not contain a valid string representation of the type defined by the vtype

Item.label: ConvertUtcDateTimeToNeutral

arguments.parameter: If utcStr doesn't have an offset it's interpreted as UTC date/time; i.e. as it would have offset +0000. If the parameter has an offset then it's interpreted as the exact moment of time that is specified by the parameter.

Item.returns: The convertation result.
Item.comments: Converts utcStr date to string representing the same moment of time in the time zone of the session in neutral format.
Item.exception: No time zones with name=the session time zone name found
utcStr does not contain a valid string representation of the type defined by the inPattern
The method is running on not supported platform

Item.label: GetCorporateToLocalOffset
Item.returns: Offset in minutes
Item.comments: Returns offset in minutes between corporate time zone and the local time zone of the client. If the corporate time zone is not defined by the Innovator then '0' is returned.

Item.label: applyAML

arguments.parameter: AML script to be sent to Innovator server.

Item.returns: Server response.
Item.comments: Sends request to Innovator server and returns server response as an item.
Item.remarks: It's assumed that passed AML script has a root tag <AML> that contains one or more <Item> children elements. The method send the AML script to the server and returns an Item object where the dom property is the xml response returned from the server.
Item.exception: There is a load or parse error in the AML.

Item.label: applyMethod
Item.comments: Apply a method by name, passing a string value as its body.
Item.remarks: The context for the method will be the method item, in the form: <Item type="Method" action="{methodName}">{body}</Item> Note, that only methods that use IOM namespace from .NET (C#, VBScript) can be applied, and methods written in JavaScript cannot be applied.

Item.label: applySQL

arguments.parameter: SQL to be sent to Innovator server.

Item.returns: Server response.
Item.comments: Sends SQL request to Innovator server and returns server response as an Item.
Item.remarks: Uses "ApplySQL" type of server request. In the returned Item object the dom property is the XML returned from the server.

Item.remarks: The method sends a request to Innovator server to obtain activities.

Item.comments: Returns an Item object that matches the ItemType name and ID for the Item.

• Item type is not specified.
  • Item ID is not specified.

Item.label: getItemInDom
Item.returns: null if passed ArasXmlDocument doesn't have an <Item> node; new Item otherwise.
Item.comments: Returns an Item with the node property referencing the first found <Item> node from the passed ArasXmlDocument.
Item.remarks: If passed ArasXmlDocument doesn't have an <Item> node the method returns null; otherwise OuterXml of the passed ArasXmlDocument is loaded into the item's dom.

Item.label: getNewID
Item.returns: New GUID.
Item.comments: A new 32 character hex string based on a GUID.

Item.label: getNextSequence
Item.returns: New sequence value if request to the server succeeded, null otherwise.
Item.comments: Returns the next sequence value by sequence name.
Item.remarks: Method makes a request to Innovator server in order to get new sequence value.

Item.label: getUserAliases
Item.returns: Comma delimited string of Identity ID's; if request to the server failed or no aliases were found the return value is an empty string.
Item.comments: Returns aliases of the logged-in user.
Item.remarks: The method makes a request to Innovator server to obtain aliases of the logged-in user. The return value is a comma delimited string of Identity ID's, which are 'Alias' relationships to the User Item.

Item.label: getUserID
Item.returns: User id.
Item.comments: Returns id of the user assosiated with a given instance of Innovator if this user is currently logged in, otherwise throws "Not logged in" exception.

Item.label: newError

arguments.parameter: Is used to populate the <faultstring> tag inside <Fault> node. According to the SOAP 1.1 specification the faultstring element is intended to provide a human readable explanation of the fault and is not intended for algorithmic processing. Note, that passed message is set as InnerText on the <faultstring> element without any pre-processing, so symbols like '<', '>', etc. will be escaped.

Item.returns: Created "error" item.
Item.comments: Returns a new "error" item.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item.
Item.remarks: The new Item will have no properties.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item with the specified type.
Item.remarks: The ItemType name is used to set the 'type' attribute. The new Item will have no properties. In order to populate it with default property values of its ItemType call Item.fetchDefaultPropertyValues(true) on the item.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item with the specified type and action.
Item.remarks: The ItemType name is used to set the 'type' attribute and the action name is used to set the 'action' attribute on the Item. The new Item will have no properties. In order to populate it with default property values of its ItemType call Item.fetchDefaultPropertyValues(true) on the item.

arguments.parameter: Text to be set as the body for the <Result> tag.

Item.returns: Created item.
Item.comments: Returns an Item where the text passed in as the argument is the body for the <Result> tag.
Item.remarks: After the insertion the method performs a verification that resulting AML is well-formed XML. If passed text contains any XML escape symbols it's user's responsibility to put the text inside a 'CDATA' block.
Item.exception: Resulting AML is not well-formed XML.

Item.comments: Creates new ArasXmlDocument.
Item.remarks: Returned ArasXmlDocument has property PreserveWhitespace set to true.

Item.label: XPathFault
Item.comments: XPath to the root <Fault> node in case the instance represents an "error" item. This field is read-only.
Item.remarks: It's recommended to use get\setErrorXXX() methods (e.g. getErrorDetails() or setErrorDetails(), etc.) in order to get\set fault information. Note that this field is not available from JavaScript.

Item.label: XPathResult
Item.comments: XPath to the <Result> tag in server response XML. This field is read-only.
Item.remarks: Note that this field is not available from JavaScript. Use the string constant //Result instead.

Item.label: XPathResultItem
Item.comments: XPath to the top_level <Item> tag(s) in item's internal AML. This field is read-only.
Item.remarks: Note that this field is not available from JavaScript. Use the string constant //Result/Item instead.

Item.label: addRelationship

arguments.parameter: Items to be added to item's relationships.

Item.comments: Add specified item as a relationship item to the instance.
Item.remarks: No checking that passed item is a relationship of this is performed. The method just inserts passed item's node under 'Relationships' node inside this.node (if 'Relationships' node doesn't exist, it's created). After the method was called the item passed as argument to the method shares its dom with this (i.e. both items reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument through their dom properties).
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The argument is not a single item.

Item.label: appendItem
Item.comments: Appends passed item to this.nodeList.
Item.remarks: The method works only if all nodes from this.nodeList (if available) and this.node are siblings; otherwise an exception is thrown. The method does the following: this.node != null: a) moves this.node into this.nodeList providing that all of them are siblings (this.node is set to null after that); b) appends passed item's node into this.nodeList; if passed item's node is not set (is null), appends to this.nodeList all nodes from passed item's nodeList. Note, that either passed item's node or nodeList is appended to this.nodeList, but not both. this.node == null AND this.nodeList != null: a) checks that all nodes in the this.nodeList are siblings; b) appends passed item nodes to this.nodeList same way as in the case this.node != nullthis.node == null AND this.nodeList == null: throws an exception. Note, that the item passed as the argument to the method is not changed in the method.
Item.exception:
• this has invalid internal structure (e.g. this.node is from a different DOM then this.dom, etc.)
  • this.node is not a sibling with nodes from this.nodeList or (if this.node == null) not all nodes from this.nodeList are siblings.
Passed item has invalid internal structure (e.g. item's node is from a different DOM then item's dom, etc.)

Item.label: apply

arguments.parameter: Action name. Overwrites current action set on the item. Note, that action can also be set when item is created or by Item.setAction(...) method.

Item.returns: Returns an Item where the dom property is the XML returned from the server. The dom may contain an Item, a forest of Items (i.e. a disjoint union of AML trees), or an error.
Item.comments: Sets action attribute on the item and applies the AML, which is the XML of this.dom.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

Item.label: apply

arguments.parameter: A collection of name-value pairs where 'name' is interpreted as 'property name' and 'value' as the property value. Specified in the collection properties are set on the item prior to applying its AML.

Item.returns: Returns an Item where the dom property is the XML returned from the server. The dom may contain an Item, a forest of Items (i.e. a disjoint union of AML trees), or an error.
Item.comments: Sets specified properties and applies the AML, which is the XML of this.dom.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

Item.label: apply
Item.returns: Returns an Item where the dom property is the XML returned from the server. The dom may contain an Item, a forest of Items (i.e. a disjoint union of AML trees), or an error.
Item.comments: Applies the AML, which is the XML of this.dom.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

Item.label: apply

arguments.parameter: Action name. Overwrites current action set on the item. Note, that action can also be set when item is created or by Item.setAction(...) method.

A collection of name-value pairs where 'name' is interpreted as 'property name' and 'value' as the property value. Specified in the collection properties are set on the item prior to applying its AML.

Item.returns: Returns an Item where the dom property is the XML returned from the server. The dom may contain an Item, a forest of Items (i.e. a disjoint union of AML trees), or an error.
Item.comments: Sets action attribute on the item; sets specified properties and applies the AML, which is the XML of this.dom.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

Item.label: apply

arguments.parameter: The action argument is optional and if passed is assigned to the action attribute. The action can be assigned when the Item was created or by the setAction() method.

A collection of name-value pairs where 'name' is interpreted as 'property name' and 'value' as the property value. Specified in the collection properties are set on the item prior to applying its AML.

The location argument value is either client or server and is only meaningful on the client side. The location is optional and defaults to server. If location is client the Method specified by the action attribute value is loaded into the client and is evaluated as an anonymous function for the Item object so the code is evaluated with the context object.

Item.returns: Returns an Item where the dom property is the XML returned from the server. The dom may contain an Item, a forest of Items (i.e. a disjoint union of AML trees), or an Error.
Item.comments: Applies the AML, which is the XML of 'this.dom'.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

Item.label: applyStylesheet

arguments.parameter: If type='text' then it's XML text for the stylesheet; if type='url' then it's URL of a stylesheet file.
The type argument is either 'text' or a 'url' (case insensitive).

Item.returns: String that represents XML of the item's DOM after XSL transformation.
Item.comments: Performs XSL transformation of the item's DOM and returns the result of the transformation. IMPORTANT: Be very carefull when using slylesheets from untrusted urls, there's a possibility to use scripts in the stylesheets with the code that can cause damage. Make sure that the stylesheet doesn't contain intrader's script code before using.
Item.remarks: If type='url' the xslStylesheet argument is interpreted as file URL. It means that user can pass to the method URLs like: "http://localhost/mystylesheets/stylesheet1.xslt" or "file:///c:/tmp/stylesheet2.xslt"; or absolute or relative path to the file, e.g. "c:/tmp/stylesheet2.xslt" or "../../stylesheet3.xslt". The item itself is not modified by the method.
Item.exception: Failed to load the xsl.
Specified xsl does not conform to a valid stylesheet.

Item.label: attachPhysicalFile
Item.comments: Attach physical file to the item. Calling the method means that the physical will be streamed to the server when apply() is called on the item.
Item.remarks: The method could only be called on client side and for items of type 'File'. User can pass to the method either absolute or relative path to a physical file. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory (i.e. location of the client executable). It's possible to attach to the item a physical file with a name different than the value of item's property filename - in this case the file stored in vault will still have name and type equal to values of filename and file_type properties correspondingly. Note, that if physical file was moved or deleted between calls to this method and Item.apply(), the later operation would fail.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item is not of type 'File'.
  • Item doesn't have ID set.
  • Failed to obtain user's default vault ID.
Specified file was not found.

Item.label: attachPhysicalFile
Item.comments: Attach physical file to the item. Calling the method means that the physical will be streamed to the server when apply() is called on the item.
Item.remarks: The method could only be called on client side and for items of type 'File'. User can pass to the method either absolute or relative path to a physical file. Relative path information is interpreted as relative to the current working directory (i.e. location of the client executable). It's possible to attach to the item a physical file with a name different than the value of item's property filename - in this case the file stored in vault will still have name and type equal to values of filename and file_type properties correspondingly. Note, that if physical file was moved or deleted between calls to this method and Item.apply(), the later operation would fail.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item is not of type 'File'.
  • Item doesn't have ID set.
  • Vault server ID is not set.
Specified file was not found.

Item.label: cancelWorkflow
Item.comments: Cancels the workflow process. Item's type must be "Workflow Process".

Item.label: checkout

arguments.parameter: Path to the directory to which the file will be checked out. The path can be either relative to the location of the client executable or absolute.

Item.returns: If checkout has failed the method returns an "error" item; otherwise this is returned.
Item.comments: Checkout physical file from the vault to the specified local directory.
Item.remarks: There are several rules about how the method could be used: a) the method could be invoked only on client; b) it's assumed that the item is of type 'File'; c) the item must have property 'filename' set. It's possible to checkout the same file multiple times. If the same file is downloaded into the same directory more than once, latest version of the file overwrites the previous one. If checkout succeeded, the method sets property 'checkedout_path' to the full path of the checked out file (this is only the run-time setting, so no update will be done in the corresponding File's record in the Innovator database.) If physical file of the item was checked out it doesn't mean that it will be send back to the server when the item is applied. In order to check-in physical file back to the server one should call attachPhysicalFile on the item prior to calling apply on it or its parent item.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item is not of type 'File'.
  • Item doesn't have ID set.
  • The item was never stored on server (i.e. has 'isNew' attribute set to '1').
File download failed.

Item.label: clone

arguments.parameter: If true, all relationships of the item are cloned as well.

Item.returns: Cloned item.
Item.comments: Clones the item.
Item.remarks: The method creates a new instance of ArasXmlDocument that is referenced by the cloned item's dom and is populated by xml of this.node. Cloned item as well as cloned relationships have new IDs and action attributes set to 'add'.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
this.node or some of its children nodes are read-only.

Item.label: closeWorkflow
Item.comments: Closes the workflow process. Item's type must be "Workflow Process".

Item.label: createPropertyItem

arguments.parameter: Name of the action that will be set on the item property.

Item.returns: Created item with the specified type and action.
Item.comments: Creates an item with the specified type and action and sets it as the specified property of this item.
Item.remarks: Returned item shares dom property with this item (i.e. both returned item's and this item's dom reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument). The method is similar to setPropertyItem(propName, item) except that setPropertyItem(propName, item) gets an item as the method argument and doesn't create it internally.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).
Property node is read-only.

Item.label: createRelatedItem

arguments.parameter: Name of the action that will be set on created related item.

Item.returns: Created related item with specified type and action.
Item.comments: Creates an item with the specified type and action and sets it as the related item on this item.
Item.remarks: If property related_id doesn't exist on this item, it's created. Returned item shares dom property with this item (i.e. both returned item's and this item's dom reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument). The method is similar to setRelatedItem(Item) except that setRelatedItem(Item) gets related item as method argument and doesn't create it internally.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).
'related_id' node is read-only.

Item.label: createRelationship

arguments.parameter: Value of attribute 'type' that will be set on the created <Item> node.
Value of attribute 'action' that will be set on the created <Item> node.

Item.returns: Item that reference newly created <Item> node. Returned item shares it's DOM with this item, i.e. both items reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument throught their dom properties.
Item.comments: Creates new <Item> node with specified 'type' and 'action' under <Relationships> node inside this.node.
Item.remarks: If <Relationships> node doesn't exist inside this.node, it's created.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).
'Relationships' node being updated is read-only.

Item.label: email
Item.returns: 'true' if mail was successfully sent, 'false' otherwise
Item.comments: Send e-mail to the specified identity. In order to do so, the method sends a special request to the Innovator server.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: fetchDefaultPropertyValues
Item.returns: If fetching failed, returns "error" item that contains information about the failure. Otherwise, returns this with set property values.
Item.comments: Fetches from server default values for all properties of the item's ItemType and sets them on the item.
Item.remarks: If a property doesn't have a default value, the property is not set.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The item doesn't have attribute 'type' set.

Item.label: fetchFileProperty

arguments.parameter: Name of property of type File for which physical file needs to be downloaded
Path to folder or file to which physical file should be downloaded. Here is examples of possible values: - Folder path, example: C:/temp/ - Full file path, example: C:/temp/1.txt
Responsible for reflecting in which mode operation should be completed.

Item.returns: Item of type File. Property "checkedout_path" of item will be populated by the path to which file was downloaded.
Item.comments: Downloads a file to target path.
Item.exception:
• Agrument "propertyName" is null or empty.
  • Agrument "targetPath" is null or empty.
• Agrument "mode" is not a part of FetchFileMode enumeration.

Item.label: fetchLockStatus

item.description: -1 - failed to fetch item's lock status from server

Item.comments: Fetches from the server the locked status of the item using the item's ID.
Item.remarks: The method sends a request to the server in order to fetch the latest lock status of the item on server and updates the item's property locked_by_id.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The item's type or ID is not set.

Item.label: fetchRelationships
Item.returns: If server request failed the method returns an "error" item; otherwise it returns this.
Item.comments: Fetches relationships of specified type from the server and sets them on the item.
Item.remarks: The method performs a server request.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item's ID is not set.
Relationship type either null or empty.

Item.label: fetchRelationships

arguments.parameter: Select list that is set on attribute 'select' of the request (see "Programmer's Guide" for more info on format of select list).

Item.returns: If server request failed the method returns an "error" item; otherwise it returns this.
Item.comments: Fetches relationships of specified type from the server and sets them on the item. Specified select list will be set on the request AML.
Item.remarks: The method performs a server request.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item's ID is not set.
Relationship type either null or empty.

Item.label: fetchRelationships

arguments.parameter: Select list that is set on attribute 'select' of the request (see "Programmer's Guide" for more info on format of select list).
The value is set on attribute 'order_by' of the request (see "Programmer's Guide" for more info on format of 'order_by').

Item.returns: If server request failed the method returns an "error" item; otherwise it returns this.
Item.comments: Fetches relationships of specified type from the server and sets them on the item. Specified select list and order are set on the request AML.
Item.remarks: The method performs a server request. If relationships of the specified type already exist on this.node they are removed and replaced by the relationships fetched from the server.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Item's ID is not set.
Relationship type either null or empty.

Item.label: getAction
Item.returns: Value of the 'action' attribute if the attribute exists, empty string otherwise
Item.comments: Returns the 'action' attribute from the Item node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getAttribute

arguments.parameter: The qualified name of the attribute.

Item.returns: Attribute value or null if the attribute doesn't exist
Item.comments: Returns value of the attribute with the specified name on the item's node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getAttribute

arguments.parameter: The qualified name of the attribute.

Item.returns: Attribute value if the attribute exists, default value otherwise
Item.comments: Returns value of the attribute with the specified name on the item's node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getErrorCode
Item.returns: Value of <faultcode>. If the item is not an "error" item, empty string is returned.
Item.comments: Gets error code of the "error" item.

Item.label: getErrorDetail
Item.returns: If the instance is not an error item an empty string is retured.
Item.comments: Returns details of the error item.
Item.remarks: In most cases error details contains a low level error details (e.g. actual SQL error message) obtained from server.

Item.label: getErrorSource
Item.returns: If the instance is not an error item, an empty string is returned.
Item.comments: Returns the content of the <faultactor> element of SOAP Fault element.

Item.label: getErrorString
Item.returns: The returned value is obtained from the <faultstring> tag of <Fault>. If the instance is not an error item an emtpy string is returned.
Item.comments: Returns the error message.

Item.label: getErrorWho
Item.returns: Value of <faultcode>.
Item.comments: Same as getErrorCode().

Item.label: getFileName
Item.returns: Name of the physical file attached to the Item of type "File".
Item.comments: Returns the filename for the attached file. This is only is meaningful if the type="File", otherwise throws an exception.

Item.label: getID
Item.returns: ID of the item or empty string if ID was not found.
Item.comments: Returns ID of the Item node. According to AML standard ID could be set on <Item> either as the attribute with name 'id' or as a sub-tag <id> (i.e. item property) or both.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getInnovator
Item.comments: Returns instance of Innovator this Item "belongs" to.

Item.label: getItemByIndex
Item.returns: Found item. Returned item shares its dom with this item (i.e. returned item and this item dom property reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument).
Item.comments: Gets an item by index.
Item.remarks: The returned item shares the dome with this item.
Item.exception: The instance does not represent a collection of items.
Passed index is out of range.

Item.label: getItemCount

item.description: '0' if the item is an error with error code 0 (No Items Found).
'-1' if the item is an error of any other type
N (where N is a positive integer for number of items that the instance represents) if the item is not an error

Item.comments: Returns the number of items that the instance represents.

Item.label: getItemsByXPath
Item.returns: Instance of the class that represents either a single item or a collection of items. The collection could be empty. The returned item shares its dom with this item, i.e. returned item dom and this.dom reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument.
Item.comments: Gets an item (single or collection) resolving xpath specified.
Item.remarks: The method applies the specified xpath on this.node if it's set or on this.dom otherwise. If a single <Item> node was found, it's assigned to the node. If 0 or more than 1 <Item> nodes were found, it's referenced by the nodeList of the returned item.
Item.exception: Item's internal structure is wrong (e.g. this.dom == null)
Specified XPath doesn't resolve to <Item> nodes.

Item.label: getLockStatus
Item.comments: Gets item's lock status based on the property locked_by_id.
Item.remarks: If the property locked_by_id is not set on item's AML, the method returns 0. In order to fetch item's lock status from the server use fetchLockStatus.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getLogicalChildren
Item.returns: Item object with the nodeList containing logical nodes that are direct children of the this.node. The returned item shares its dom with this item.
Item.comments: Returns Item object with the nodeList containing logical nodes that are children of the this.node.
Item.exception: The instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referencing <Item> node) nor a logical item.

Item.label: getLogicalItems
Item.returns: Item object with the nodeList containing all logical nodes of this.node. The returned item shares its dom with this item.
Item.comments: Returns the Item object with the nodeList containing all logical nodes of this.node.
Item.exception: The instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referencing <Item> node) nor a logical item.

Item.label: getNewID
Item.returns: GUID as a string
Item.comments: Generate new 32 character hex string globally unique identifier.

Item.label: getParentItem
Item.returns: If this.node doesn't have an ancestor::Item, null is returned.
Item.comments: Returns a parent item of the instance.
Item.remarks: The returned parent item is constructed the following way: dom = this.domnode = this.node.SelectSingleItem( "ancestor::Item" ) Note, that returned item dom and this.dom reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getProperty
Item.returns: If the property is an item-property, ID of the item-property is returned. If the property doesn't exist or it's an item-property without ID, null is returned ( in JavaScript undefined is return) ; otherwise the method returns value of the specified property.
Item.comments: Gets value of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getProperty
Item.returns: If the property is an item-property, ID of the item-property is returned. If the property doesn't exist or it's an item-property without ID, the default value is returned; otherwise the method returns value of the specified property. Note, that if the property has attribute is_null set to 1 and the property value is empty string (e.g. <p1 is_null='1'/> or <p1 is_null='1'></p1>) then the property value is interpreted as null.
Item.comments: Gets value of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getProperty

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property value has to be returned. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.returns: If the property is an item-property, ID of the item-property is returned. If the property doesn't exist or it's an item-property without ID, the default value is returned; otherwise the method returns value of the specified property name for the specified language.
Item.comments: Gets value of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyAttribute
Item.returns: If either property with the specified name or the specified attribute on the property doesn't exist, returns null ( in JavaScript, returns undefined.)
Item.comments: Gets the specified attribute of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyAttribute
Item.returns: If either property with the specified name or the specified attribute on the property doesn't exist, returns the default value.
Item.comments: Gets the specified attribute of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyAttribute

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property attribute has to be returned. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.returns: If either property with the specified name or the specified attribute on the property doesn't exist, returns the default value; otherwise returns value of the property attribute for the specified language.
Item.comments: Gets the specified attribute of the property with the specified name and language.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyCondition
Item.returns: If either property with the specified name or attribute 'condition' on the property doesn't exist, returns null ( in JavaScript, returns undefined.)
Item.comments: Gets the 'condition' attribute of the property with the specified name.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyCondition

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property condition has to be returned. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.returns: If either property with the specified name or attribute 'condition' on the property doesn't exist, returns null.
Item.comments: Gets the 'condition' attribute of the property with the specified name and language.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getPropertyItem
Item.returns: Found item-property. If by some reason an item can't be returned (e.g. 'this.dom' doesn't have a property with the specified name or the property contains just id but type of the item-property is unknown), the method returns null. NOTE: If specified property name is 'id' then the method returns this item.
Item.comments: Gets item-property by name.
Item.remarks: The method tries to find the specified property on the item. If found, the propery may either a) contain child <Item> node or b) contain just id. In case a), the child <Item> node is used for constructing the returned Item; note, that in this case the returned item shares dom with this item. In case b), an attempt is made to construct a simple Item with the following dom: <Item type='...' id='...'><id>...</id></Item> to be returned. Note that in this case, the returned Item doesn't share its dom with this.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelatedItem
Item.returns: Related item. If by some reason the related item can't be returned (e.g. 'this.dom' doesn't have 'related_id' property or type of the related item is unknown), the method returns null.
Item.comments: Gets related item of the relationship.
Item.remarks: Tries to find related_id property on the item. If found, the propery may either a) contain child <Item> node or b) contain just id. In case a), the child <Item> node is used for constructing the returned Item; note, that in this case the returned item shares dom with this item. In case b), an attempt is made to construct a simple Item with the following dom: <Item type='...' id='...'><id>...</id></Item> to be returned. Note that in this case, the returned Item doesn't share its dom with this.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelatedItemID
Item.returns: ID of the related item. If related item not found, return empty string.
Item.comments: Tries to find related item (xpath: "./related_id") on item's node and returns its ID.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelationships
Item.returns: Item that is a collection of relationship items with specified name. If this doesn't have any relationship of this type, the returned item nodeList will be empty.
Item.comments: Returns an item that is a collection of relationship item with specified type; each relationship item has only properties specified in the select list.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelationships

arguments.parameter: Comma delimited list of property names used to set the SQL "ORDER BY" clause.

Item.returns: Item that is a collection of relationship items with specified name. If this doesn't have any relationship of this type, the returned item nodeList will be empty.
Item.comments: Returns an item that is a collection of relationship item with specified type; each relationship item has only properties specified in the select list.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelationships
Item.returns: Item that is a collection of all relationships items available on the instance. If this doesn't have relationships, the returned item nodeList will be empty.
Item.comments: Returns an item that is a collection of all relationships items available on the instance.
Item.remarks: The methods does not make a request to the server but rather returns relationships items available on this.dom in memory. If order to get relationships from server please use fetchRelationships(...) methods.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getRelationships
Item.returns: Item that is a collection of relationships items with specified name available on the instance. If this doesn't have any relationships of this type, the returned item nodeList will be empty.
Item.comments: Returns an item that is a collection of relationships item with specified type available on the instance.
Item.remarks: The methods does not make a request to the server but rather returns relationships items available on this.dom in memory. If order to get relationships from server please use fetchRelationships(...) methods.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: getResult
Item.returns: If this.dom is null or node with xpath = Item.XPathResult was not found, the method returns an empty string.
Item.comments: Returns 'InnerText' property of ArasXmlNode with xpath = Item.XPathResult from the item's dom.

Item.label: getType
Item.returns: Value of 'type' attribute if the attribute exists, empty string otherwise.
Item.comments: Returns value of the 'type' attribute of the Item node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: instantiateWorkflow
Item.returns: Returns a Workflow Process item created by this method or an "error" item.
Item.comments: Instantiates workflow for the item using specified workflow map.
Item.remarks: The method does the following: a) sends a request to the server to instantiate the specified Workflow Map to a Workflow Process b) using ID of the WorkflowProcess item obtained from the server, sends another request to attach the Workflow Process to the controlled item via the "Workflow" relationship. Note, that the item itself is not modified by the method.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • Either 'id' or 'typeId' is not set on the item.
  • The item is a new item not saved in the database yet.
WorkflowMap ID is either 'null' or empty string.

Item.label: isCollection
Item.returns: 'true' if this.nodeList != null AND this.node == null, 'false' otherwise
Item.comments: Checks if the instance represents a set of items and not a single item.

Item.label: isEmpty
Item.returns: 'true' if the item is an error but has faultcode="0", 'false' otherwise.
Item.comments: This is the replacement for the old hasFault() function with the Boolean argument of false to indicate to ignore the zero based faults.

Item.label: isError
Item.returns: 'true' if the item is an "error item" (i.e. this.dom has a top_level tag Item.XPathFault), 'false' otherwise
Item.comments: Checks if the item is an "error item".

Item.label: isLocked
Item.comments: Fetches from the server the locked status of the item using the item's ID.
Item.remarks: The method sends a request to the server to fetch item's lock status only if the item doesn't have property locked_by_id set, otherwise the value of the property is returned.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

Item.label: isLogical
Item.returns: true if the this.node != null and this.node.LocalName is "AND" | "OR" | "NOT" (case insensitive); false otherwise.
Item.comments: Find out if the item's node is a "logical" node ("AND", "OR", "NOT").

Item.label: isNew
Item.returns: 'true' if the Item has the attribute 'isNew' set to '1', 'false' otherwise
Item.comments: Checks the attribute 'isNew' on the item.

Item.label: isRoot
Item.returns: 'true' if this.node is the top 'Item' node in this.dom, 'false' otherwise
Item.comments: Checks if this.node is the root item in this.dom.

Item.label: loadAML

arguments.parameter: String with AML script. For more details on format of AML please read "Innovator Programmer's Guide".

Item.comments: This loads the dom property for the Item object with the passed AML. The method will also set the node and nodeList properties for the Item object according to the content of the loaded AML.
Item.remarks: In general, loaded AML could present any valid XmlDocument. However, user must follow one of supported AML formats in order to benefit from IOM public API. The most popular of supported AML formats are shown below: AMLs representing a Single Innovator Item: (a) Item node as a root <Item > <prop1>a</prop1> ... <propN>b</propN> </Item> (b) SOAP-Result wrapper <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <Result> <Item > <prop1>a</prop1> ... <propN>b</propN> </Item> </Result> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> AMLs representing a Set of Innovator Items: (a) AML node as a root <AML> <Item ... /> ... <Item ... /> </AML> (b) SOAP-Result wrapper <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <Result> <Item > <prop1>a</prop1> ... <propN>b</propN> </Item> ... <Item > <prop1>a</prop1> .... <propM>b</propM> </Item> </Result> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> AML representing an Error: <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <SOAP-ENV:Fault> <faultcode>[int]</faultcode> <faultactor>...</faultactor> <detail><...></detail> </SOAP-ENV:Fault> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope> AML representing a SOAP-Result wrapper for an arbitrary Text: <SOAP-ENV:Envelope xmlns:SOAP-ENV=.../> <SOAP-ENV:Body> <Result>[text]</Result> </SOAP-ENV:Body> </SOAP-ENV:Envelope>
Item.exception: There is a load or parse error in the AML. Item remains uninitialized.

Item.label: lockItem
Item.returns: Response item from the server.
Item.comments: Applies the 'lock' action on the item and returns the server response.
Item.remarks: The method sends a request to the server to lock the item. This is almost the equivalent to this.apply("lock") except that: a) the method checks that item's type and ID are set before sending the request; b) the method updates locked_by_id property of this item with the value obtained from the server if the server response is not an error.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The item's type or ID is not set.

Item.label: newAND
Item.returns: Logical "AND" item. Returned item shares dom with this item.
Item.comments: Inserts logical node with tag <and> under the parent node, which can be Item or Logical, and returns an Item Object that represents a newly inserted logical node.
Item.remarks: Logical item is an item which node references to the "logical" tag, i.e. 'or', 'and' or 'not'. Logical items are used to build request conditions where item's properties serve as condition expressions. User has to use setProperty(...), setPropertyCondition(...) to set condition expressions on logical item (see example below). It's possible to build nested logical request conditions by calling newOR(), newAND() or newNOT() on a logical item.
Item.exception: If the instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referencing <Item> node) nor a logical item.
this.node is read-only.

Item.label: newInnovator
Item.returns: New instance of Innovator.
Item.comments: Creates a new Innovator object.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item.
Item.remarks: The new Item will have no properties.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item with the specified type.
Item.remarks: The ItemType name is used to set the 'type' attribute. The new Item will have no properties. In order to populate it with default property values of its ItemType call Item.fetchDefaultPropertyValues(true) on the item.

Item.label: newItem
Item.returns: Newly created instance of Item.
Item.comments: Returns a new Item with the specified type and action.
Item.remarks: The ItemType name is used to set the 'type' attribute and the action name is used to set the 'action' attribute on the Item. The new Item will have no properties. In order to populate it with default property values of its ItemType call Item.fetchDefaultPropertyValues(true) on the item.

Item.label: newNOT
Item.returns: Logical "NOT" item. Returned item shares dom with this item.
Item.comments: Inserts logical node with tag <not> under the parent node, which can be Item or Logical, and returns an Item Object that represents a newly inserted logical node.
Item.remarks: Logical item is an item which node references to the "logical" tag, i.e. 'or', 'and' or 'not'. Logical items are used to build request conditions where item's properties serve as condition expressions. User has to use setProperty(...), setPropertyCondition(...) to set condition expressions on logical item (see example below). It's possible to build nested logical request conditions by calling newOR(), newAND() or newNOT() on a logical item.
Item.exception: If the instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referncing <Item> node) nor a logical item.
this.node is read-only.

Item.label: newOR
Item.returns: Logical "OR" item. Returned item shares dom with this item.
Item.comments: Inserts logical node with tag <or> under the parent node, which can be Item or Logical, and returns an Item Object that represents a newly inserted logical node.
Item.remarks: Logical item is an item which node references to the "logical" tag, i.e. 'or', 'and' or 'not'. Logical items are used to build request conditions where item's properties serve as condition expressions. User has to use setProperty(...), setPropertyCondition(...) to set condition expressions on logical item (see example below). It's possible to build nested logical request conditions by calling newOR(), newAND() or newNOT() on a logical item.
Item.exception: If the instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referencing <Item> node) nor a logical item.
this.node is read-only.

Item.label: newXMLDocument
Item.returns: Instance of System.Xml.ArasXmlDocument
Item.comments: Creates new ArasXmlDocument.
Item.remarks: Returned ArasXmlDocument has property PreserveWhitespace set to true.

Item.label: promote

arguments.parameter: If ItemType of the item is configured to log "history" records when items of the ItemType are created\promoted\etc., (i.e. if the ItemType's property "save_history" is set to "1") then the comments will be used as a comment for the "history" record about the promote event.

Item.returns: "Result" item with inner text "Ok" in case of success. Otherwise "error" item (if promote failed).
Item.comments: Promote item to the specified state.
Item.remarks: The method sends a request to the server to promote item and returns the response. Note that this item is not modified by the method.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
Argument 'state' is either 'null' or an empty string.

Item.label: removeAttribute

arguments.parameter: The name of the attribute to remove.This is a qualified name.

Item.comments: Removes the specified attribute if the attribute exist; does nothing otherwise.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removeItem
Item.comments: Remove specified item from the this.dom
Item.remarks: this has to represent a collection of items. Passed item's dom must reference the same ArasXmlDocument as this.dom. If passed item's node is not null, the node and all its sub-items are removed from this.dom; else if passed item's nodeList is not null, every element of the list and its children are removed from this.dom. If before the removal either this.node or this.nodeList referenced any of the removed items, those properties are adjusted, i.e. this.node is set to null and\or this.nodeList is stripped of items that were just removed.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a collection of items.

• Passed item and this don't reference the same ArasXmlDocument.
  • Passed item has wrong internal strucure; e.g. both node and nodeList are null; etc.
  • Can't remove an item node as its parent node is read-only.

Item.label: removeLogical
Item.comments: Removes logical node referenced by the passed item from this.node.
Item.remarks: It's assumed that passed item's node is a child of this.node.
Item.exception: The instance is neither a single regular item (i.e. item referencing <Item> node) nor a logical item.

• Passed item is not a logical item.
  • The passed item is not a child of this item. Or this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removeProperty
Item.comments: Removes the property tag with the specified name from the item's dom.
Item.remarks: No action if the specified property was not found.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removeProperty

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property needs to be removed. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.comments: Removes the property tag with the specified name and language from the item's dom.
Item.remarks: No action if the specified property was not found.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removePropertyAttribute
Item.comments: Modifies item's node by removing attribute on the specified property.
Item.remarks: No action if either specified property or attribute were not found.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removePropertyAttribute

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property attribute needs to be removed. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.comments: Modifies item's node by removing attribute on the specified property with the specified xml:lang attribute.
Item.remarks: No action if either specified property or attribute were not found.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: removeRelationship

arguments.parameter: The relationship item to be removed.

Item.comments: Removes the passed item's node from the 'Relationships' node of the item.
Item.remarks: Method doesn't sent a request to the server, it just edits item's DOM in memory. Passed item must share its dom with this item, i.e. both items dom must reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.

• Passed item doesn't represent a single item.
  • Passed item doesn't share its dom with this item.
  • Passed item is not a relationship.
  • 'Relationship' node of this is read-only.

Item.label: setAction
Item.comments: Set the 'action' attribute on this.node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setAttribute

arguments.parameter: The name of the attribute to create or alter. This is a qualified name. If the name contains a colon it is parsed into prefix and local name components.
The value to set for the attribute.

Item.comments: Set the value of the attribute with the specified name on the item's node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The specified attribute name contains an invalid character.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setErrorCode
Item.comments: Sets error code on the "error" item.
Item.remarks: If the item is not an "error" item, the method does nothing.

Item.label: setErrorDetail

arguments.parameter: Error details that are set as InnerText on <detail> element of <Fault> without any pre-processing, so symbols like '<', '>', etc. will be escaped.

Item.comments: Sets the detailed error message of the error item.
Item.remarks: Error details are always placed in <detail> tag inside CDATA block. If the instance is not an error item the method does nothing.

Item.label: setErrorSource

arguments.parameter: Value to be set on 'faultactor' element of SOAP Fault.

Item.comments: Sets the <faultactor> of the SOAP Fault element. If the instance is not an error item, the method does nothing.

Item.label: setErrorString
Item.comments: Sets the error message of the error item.
Item.remarks: Passed value is set on <faultstring> tag of <Fault>. If the instance is not an error item the method does nothing.

Item.label: setErrorWho
Item.comments: Same as setErrorCode().

Item.label: setFileName
Item.comments: Set the filename for the attached file. This is only is meaningful if the type="File" and will cause the apply() to submit multipart/form-data to the VaultServer.

Item.label: setFileProperty

arguments.parameter: name of property of type File for which new physical file should be set
path to physical file which should be attached to property of the item

Item.returns: Item of type File generated by method
Item.comments: Set a file to an item reference.
Item.remarks: This method will allow to add/update a value of property with data type Item and data source File. Internally it will be created an item "File" with action "add" and set this new item to the property with name "propertyName". When Apply method would be called on the container item, new file will uploaded to the user's default vault server.
Item.exception:
• Agrument "propertyName" is null or empty.
  • Agrument "pathToFile" is null or empty.

Item.label: setID
Item.comments: Set the id attribute on the Item node. If the item has the property id as well, the property is set too.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setNewID
Item.comments: Gets new ID by calling getNewID() then passes obtained ID to setID(id).
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setProperty

arguments.parameter: Value to be set on the property.

Item.comments: Set the property with the specified name. If property doesn't exist on the item, create it first and then set.
Item.remarks: If property has attribute is_null set to 1 and specified property value is not an empty string, the attribute is removed from the property. If specified property value is null, then attribute is_null='1' is set on the property and it's value is set to empty string (i.e. after setting null value the property tag will look like: <prop is_null='1' />).
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setProperty

arguments.parameter: Value to be set on the property.
Language for which the property needs to be set. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.comments: Set the property with the specified name and language. If property doesn't exist on the item, create it first and then set.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setPropertyAttribute
Item.comments: Set the attribute for the specified property.
Item.remarks: If property tag with the specified name doesn't exist in this.node, the property tag is created after which the attribute is set on it. Note, that if the property tag is created by the method, the property value (i.e. tag's InnerText) is empty.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The specified attribute name contains an invalid character.
The property node\tag is read-only.

Item.label: setPropertyAttribute

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property attribute has to be set. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.comments: Set the attribute for the specified property and language.
Item.remarks: If property tag with the specified name and language doesn't exist in this.node, the property tag is created after which the attribute is set on it. Note, that if the property tag is created by the method, the property value (i.e. tag's InnerText) is empty.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The specified attribute name contains an invalid character.
The property node\tag is read-only.

Item.label: setPropertyCondition
Item.comments: Sets the attribute 'condition' on the specified property.
Item.remarks: If property tag with the specified name doesn't exist in this.node, the property tag is created after which the attribute 'condition' is set on it. Note, that if the property tag is created by the method, the property value (i.e. tag's InnerText) is empty. See "Innovator Programmer's Guide" for more details on condition syntax.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The property node is read-only.

Item.label: setPropertyCondition

arguments.parameter: Language for which the property condition has to be set. If null value is passed, the language of the current session is assumed.

Item.comments: Sets the attribute 'condition' on the specified property with the specified language.
Item.remarks: If property tag with the specified name and language doesn't exist in this.node, the property tag is created after which the attribute 'condition' is set on it. Note, that if the property tag is created by the method, the property value (i.e. tag's InnerText) is empty. See "Innovator Programmer's Guide" for more details on condition syntax.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The property node is read-only.

Item.label: setPropertyItem

arguments.parameter: Instance of Item whose 'node' appends or replaces child <Item> node under the specified property.

Item.returns: Instance of the class that represent the item-property. Returned item shares its 'dom' with this (i.e. dom property of both instances points to the same instance of ArasXmlDocument).
Item.comments: Sets a property to an item reference.
Item.remarks: The method is trying to find the property with the specified name on the item. If not found, creates it. If the property's node contains child <Item> node, replace it with the passed item, else append passed item to the property's node. After the method was called, the passed item shares its 'dom' with this (i.e. 'dom' property of both instances points to the same instance of ArasXmlDocument).
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

• The item passed to the method doesn't represent a single item.
  • this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setRelatedItem
Item.comments: Sets the 'related_id' property to an item reference.
Item.remarks: The method is trying to find 'related_id' property on the item. If not found, creates it. If 'related_id' contains child <Item> node, replace it with the passed item, else append passed item to the 'related_id' node. After the method was called, the passed related item shares its dom with this item (i.e. dom property of both instances reference the same instance of ArasXmlDocument).
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The instance has a wrong internal structure (e.g. item.node doesn't belong to item.dom; etc.).

• The item passed to the method doesn't represent a single item.
  • this.node is read-only.

Item.label: setType
Item.comments: Set the 'type' attribute on the Item node.
Item.exception: The instance doesn't represent a single item.
The this.node is read-only.

Item.returns: Response item from the server.
Item.comments: Applies the 'unlock' action on the item and returns the server response.
Item.remarks: The method sends a request to the server to unlock the item. This is almost the equivalent to this.apply("unlock") except that: a) the method checks that item's type and ID are set before sending the request; b) the method removes locked_by_id property of this item if the server response is not an error.
Item.exception:
• The instance doesn't represent a single item.
  • The item's type or ID is not set.

Item.label: dom
Item.comments: A reference to the instance of ArasXmlDocument that holds the data for the Item in the AML format. ArasXmlDocument is an alias that represents System.Xml.XmlDocument when IOM namespace is used from .NET (C#, VBScript) and MSXML2.IXMLDOMDocument when it used from COM (JavaScript).

Item.label: node
Item.comments: A reference to the <Item> node in the dom for this Item instance. The type of node is System.Xml.XmlElement when IOM namespace is used from .NET (C#, VBScript) and MSXML2.IXMLDOMElement when it used from COM (JavaScript).

Item.label: nodeList
Item.comments: List of <Item> nodes from the dom for this Item instance. The type of nodeList is System.Xml.XmlNodeList when IOM namespace is used from .NET (C#, VBScript) and MSXML2.IXMLDOMNodeList when it used from COM (JavaScript).

Path where the physical file will be downloaded to.

Item.label: Compression
Item.comments: Property specifies the way of compression of AML sent through IOM.HttpServerConnection. Value from enumeration 'CompressionType' (namespace Aras.Common.Compression) can be set. Available values are: gzip data compression to the gzip format deflate data compression to the deflate format none Default value. Data sent through IOM.HttpServerConnection aren't compressed. It is highly recommended to store type of compression you are using in configuration file of your application. Example section of application configuration file: <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="CompressionType" value="gzip"/> </appSettings > </configuration> Examples of setting value of Compression property from application configuration file. ... HttpServerConnection connection = CreateHttpServerConnection("innovatorServerUrl"); connaction.Compression = GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig(); ... private CompressionType GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() { string value = ConfigurationManager.AppSettings["CompressionType"]; if (String.IsNullOrEmpty(value)) { return CompressionType.none; } else { return (CompressionType)Enum.Parse(typeof(CompressionType), value); } } ... Dim connection As HttpServerConnection = IomFactory.CreateHttpServerConnection("connectionstring") connection.Compression = GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() ... Private Function GetCompressionTypeFromAppConfig() As CompressionType Dim value As String = ConfigurationManager.AppSettings("CompressionType") If (String.IsNullOrEmpty(value)) Then Return CompressionType.none Else Return CType([Enum].Parse(GetType(CompressionType), value), CompressionType) End If End Function

Item.label: ReadWriteTimeout
Item.comments: Gets or sets a time-out in milliseconds when writing to or reading from a stream.

Item.label: Timeout
Item.comments: Gets or sets the time-out value in milliseconds for the System.Net.HttpWebRequest.GetResponse() and System.Net.HttpWebRequest.GetRequestStream() methods.
